description: Predicting, explaining and exploring links in large biomedical knowledge graphs.
name: LinkExplorer

metadata.abstract: Â© 2022 The Author(s) 2022. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved. For permissions, please e-mail: journals.permissions@oup.com.Summary: Machine learning algorithms for link prediction can be valuable agents for hypothesis generation. However, many current algorithms are black boxes or lack good user interfaces that could facilitate insight into why predictions are made. We present LinkExplorer, a software suite for predicting, explaining and exploring links in large biomedical knowledge graphs. LinkExplorer integrates our novel, rule-based link prediction engine SAFRAN, which was recently shown to outcompete other explainable algorithms and established black-box algorithms. Here, we demonstrate highly competitive evaluation results of our algorithm on multiple large biomedical knowledge graphs, and release a web interface that allows for interactive and intuitive exploration of predicted links and their explanations.
metadata.title: LinkExplorer: predicting, explaining and exploring links in large biomedical knowledge graphs
